001package org.relationlearn.model;
002
003import org.relationlearn.util.RelationType;
004
005/**
006 * The ArgumentRelation interface represents the link between two ArgumentNode
007 * objects and ultimately stores the RelationType value, which describes
008 * what kind of relation those nodes have.
009 * 
010 * @see org.relationlearn.util.RelationType
011 * @see ArgumentNode
012 */
013public interface ArgumentRelation {
014    
015    /**
016     * Returns this ArgumentRelation identifier.
017     * 
018     * @return the ArgumentRelation identifier
019     */
020    public int getArgumentRelationId();
021    
022    /**
023     * Returns the ArgumentNode identified as the
024     * origin of this ArgumentRelation.
025     * 
026     * @return the ArgumentNode origin of this relation
027     */
028    public ArgumentNode getArgumentator();
029    
030    /**
031     * Returns the ArgumentNode identified as the
032     * target of this ArgumentRelation.
033     * 
034     * @return the ArgumentNode destination of this relation
035     */
036    public ArgumentNode getTarget();
037    
038    /**
039     * Returns a RelationType value that describes the current known
040     * state of this ArgumentRelation.
041     * 
042     * @return the state type of this ArgumentRelation
043     */
044    public RelationType getArgumentRelationType();
045    
046    /**
047     * Sets the RelationType value of this relation to 
048     * the value of the parameter {@code t}.
049     * 
050     * @param t the new RelationType of this ArgumentRelation
051     */
052    public void changeRelationType(RelationType t);
053}
